learningContent.title: Adding images to a concept topic

lcInstruction.p:
You can add images to a concept topic in one of two ways: by placing it in the body of the concept topic, or by placing it inside a (figure) element. If you wish to give your image a title or caption, placing it inside a figure is the best choice.Introduce the element first and tell what it's used for. I'd turn the persepective around a bit more, because "placing it in the body" can be ambiguous (as a child? as a descendant?). Might be better with "To add an image to the ,..." See my global comment (Skype) about the 3 or 4 main things to hit.It's fairly common to use images inline (placement="inline") in

elements.no "wishing" or "desire" while we're at it. want or need. Try If you image needs a title or a caption, place it inside a element.

step.cmd: Make a copy of the file 1_concept_images_tables.dita and open it in your editor.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> </conbody> </concept>

step.cmd: Inside the <conbody> element, add an <image> element as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> <image href="images/ducklings_sitting.jpg"/> </conbody> </concept>

step.info: The <image> element you added contains a link (href) to the location where the image file lives. A link inside an <image> element can point to the filepath for an image on a server or to a web link for an image.Should we address width and other image-related attributes here, or is this getting into too much detail?too much detail

step.cmd: After the <image> element, add a <fig> element as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> <image href="images/ducklings_sitting.jpg"/> <fig> <title>Ducklings walking</title> <image href="ducklings_walking.jpg"/> </fig> </conbody> </concept>

step.info: The <fig> element is another way to add an image to a concept topic.

The <fig> element you added contains a <title> element and an <image> element. The <title> element allows you to associate a caption with your image. The <image> element is structured the same way whether it is inside a <fig> element or inside the <conbody> element.

The <fig> element can contain more than one <image> element.probably a good spot to point out that <title> always goes above <image> but title doesn't necessarily appear above image in output. Could be moved to all sorts of places.
